org.team5940.pantry.processing_network

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team5940.pantry.processing_network.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ValueNode

    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    A Node is a component of a single Network. Nodes perform some sort of operation 0 or 1 time(s) every network cycle: the first time update() is successfully called on a given network cycle.

      • logger

        protected Logger logger
        The logger this uses. Shocking.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(Network network,
            Logger logger,
            boolean requireUpdate,
            ValueNode<?>... sourcesArray)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
            java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Initialize a new Node.
        Parameters:
        network - The Network that this node is a part of.
        sources - The ValueNodes used by this, if null assumes no sources.
        logger - The Logger for this to use.
        requireUpdate - Whether to, by default, require updates. The requiresUpdate() method can always be overridden to change behavior.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - network is null, or one of the ValueNodes in source is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - network has already been started.

    • Method Detail

      • doUpdate

        protected abstract void doUpdate()
        Internal method for performing the node's update. It can only be called 0 or 1 time(s) per Network cycle.

      • update

        public final void update()
                  throws IllegalUpdateThreadException
        Updates this if it has not yet been updated the current network cycle.
        Throws:
        IllegalUpdateThreadException - The thread calling this method is not this' network.

      • requiresUpdate

        public boolean requiresUpdate()
        This method is used to tell the network whether the node requires an update (update() will be definitely be called this cycle). It should NOT be assumed that this method will only be called once per cycle and the value should not change in successive calls in the same cycle.
        Returns:
        True if this node should be updated this cycle, false if it can be not updated.

      • enumerateSources

        public java.util.Set<ValueNode<?>> enumerateSources()
        Gets the ValueNodes (within its network) that this Node retrieves data from. Sources should not change after initialization. The set returned must be clone and not any internally used reference. If this does not have any sources it should return an empty Set, NOT null.
        Returns:
        A Set containing any Nodes that this uses.

      • getNetwork

        public Network getNetwork()
        Gets this' Network.
        Returns:
        This' Network.

      • getLastUpdateCycle

        public long getLastUpdateCycle()
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets the last cycle that this completed an update. If this method is called in the middle of an node update it will return the last cycle before this one that it updated. If it has never been updated it will return -1.
        Returns:
        The last cycle this node updated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this node's network has not started.

      • getLabel

        public JsonArray getLabel()
